cordon.title: Cordon Node Configuration
cordon.description: Cordoning a node will prevent new Pods from being scheduled to it, but existing Pods will continue to run.
cordon.rule2: Existing Pods continue to run normally
cordon.rule3: New Pods will not be scheduled to these nodes

uncordon.title: Uncordon Node Configuration
uncordon.description: Uncordoning a node will restore its ability to accept new Pod scheduling.
uncordon.rule1: Remove the "SchedulingDisabled" mark from the node
uncordon.rule2: Node resumes accepting new Pod scheduling
uncordon.rule3: Takes effect immediately, no restart needed

drain.title: Drain Node Configuration
drain.description: Draining a node will first cordon it, then safely evict all Pods, making it safe for maintenance.
drain.warningDesc: Draining a node is a potentially destructive operation that will evict all Pods, which may cause service interruption. Make sure you understand the impact.
drain.riskServiceInterruption: I understand this operation may cause service interruption
drain.riskReplicaConfirmed: I have confirmed sufficient replicas are running on other nodes
drain.riskTeamNotified: I have notified the relevant team about this maintenance

common.reasonPlaceholder: Enter reason, e.g. planned maintenance, system upgrade
common.reasonPlaceholderRestore: Enter reason, e.g. maintenance completed, back to normal
common.reasonPlaceholderDrain: Enter reason, e.g. node maintenance, system upgrade

result.title: Operation Complete
result.suggestionDesc: Some node operations failed. Please check failure reasons and consider retrying or manual handling.

cancel.title: Confirm Cancel
cancel.content: Are you sure you want to cancel? All configured parameters will be lost.
